news.title: Trump's Fed chair candidates list narrowed down to five by Bessent after interviews, sources say
news.summary: The Treasury plans to hold another round of interviews with all five candidates in the coming weeks and months. The Treasury will also hold an interview with the president of the United States.

news.title: China retaliates against U.S. port fees with new charges on American ships
news.summary: The move comes a day after China ramped up restrictions on rare earths exports. The move comes amid ongoing tensions with the U.S.

news.title: This is the 'biggest mistake' young investors make, Josh Brown says
news.summary: Young investors worry about losing money in the stock market. But it may be riskier for them to avoid stocks in favor of cash and bonds.

news.title: How Costco quietly built a multibillion-dollar clothing empire
news.summary: Costco has grown its clothing business by nearly 40% over the past five years. That's more than its peers BJ's and Sam's Club.

news.title: Jim Cramer's top 10 things to watch in the stock market Friday
news.summary: Gold is back above $4,000 an ounce. Qualcomm shares dropped after Chinese antitrust regulators opened a probe into its acquisition of a vehicle tech firm.

news.title: Stop worrying about the AI bubble: SocGen strategists tell clients the dollar and fundamentals will sustain this rally.
news.summary: Société Générale polled clients about which aspects of U.S. markets were cause for greatest concern. The majority of respondents said they were concerned about the economy.

news.title: My uncle’s widow is threatening to sue me. She wants money from my grandmother’s estate. Should I be worried?
news.summary: “My uncle said he had recorded my grandmother saying she would change the will and add him as the beneficiary,” she said. “My grandmother said she would add him to the will,’ she said, “and he was the beneficiary.”

news.title: This money-saving hack could save you over $700 a year — and it’s in the palm of your hand
news.summary: Financial experts agree that cutting out social media can tackle an underlying cause of overspending. Social media can be a good way to cut back on spending, experts say.

news.title: Traders talk of a 1999-like melt-up. But here’s what really happened back then.
news.summary: The dotcom bubble saw the Nasdaq double in the last six months before the pop. The Nasdaq doubled in the six months leading up to the bursting of the bubble.

news.title: I’m having brain surgery. Will my heirs or the creditors get my money if I die?
news.summary: “I’m 47 and have a small amount of investments totaling about $45,000, and I also have the same amount in debt,” he says.
